publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2504# Robert Brown: Centenary of Barnardo’s—That the Parliament notes the centenary of the death of Dr Thomas Barnardo in 1905; recognises that, although it no longer runs orphanages, the charity he founded has grown and developed over the years, and congratulates the modern-day Barnardo’s for its work, which includes the management of 60 services that support almost 10,000 of Scotland’s most vulnerable and disadvantaged children and families to overcome challenges including sexual abuse, exclusion from school, HIV/AIDS, leaving care, substance misuse, disabilities, mental health issues and social exclusion.

S2M-2504# Centenary of Barnardo’s (lodged on 1 March 2005) Stewart Stevenson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Eleanor Scott*, Jackie Baillie*, Phil Gallie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, David Mundell*, Mr David Davidson*, Donald Gorrie*, Fiona Hyslop*, Des McNulty*, Mike Pringle*, Alex Fergusson*, Margaret Smith*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Murray Tosh*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Alex Neil*

S2M-2504# Centenary of Barnardo’s (lodged on 1 March 2005) Roseanna Cunningham*, Karen Whitefield*, Tommy Sheridan*, Robin Harper*, Shiona Baird*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mike Rumbles*

S2M-2504# Robert Brown: Centenary of Barnardo’s—That the Parliament notes the centenary of the death of Dr Thomas Barnardo in 1905; recognises that, although it no longer runs orphanages, the charity he founded has grown and developed over the years, and congratulates the modern-day Barnardo’s for its work, which includes the management of 60 services that support almost 10,000 of Scotland’s most vulnerable and disadvantaged children and families to overcome challenges including sexual abuse, exclusion from school, HIV/AIDS, leaving care, substance misuse, disabilities, mental health issues and social exclusion. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Eleanor Scott, Jackie Baillie, Phil Gallie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, David Mundell, Mr David Davidson, Donald Gorrie, Fiona Hyslop, Des McNulty, Mike Pringle, Alex Fergusson, Margaret Smith, Mrs Nanette Milne, Ms Wendy Alexander, Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Alex Neil, Roseanna Cunningham, Karen Whitefield, Tommy Sheridan, Robin Harper, Shiona Baird, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mike Rumbles, Rosie Kane*, Margaret Mitchell*, Ms Sandra White*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Irene Oldfather*

S2M-2504 # Robert Brown: Centenary of Barnardo’s—That the Parliament notes the centenary of the death of Dr Thomas Barnardo in 1905; recognises that, although it no longer runs orphanages, the charity he founded has grown and developed over the years, and congratulates the modern-day Barnardo’s for its work, which includes the management of 60 services that support almost 10,000 of Scotland’s most vulnerable and disadvantaged children and families to overcome challenges including sexual abuse, exclusion from school, HIV/AIDS, leaving care, substance misuse, disabilities, mental health issues and social exclusion. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Eleanor Scott, Jackie Baillie, Phil Gallie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, David Mundell, Mr David Davidson, Donald Gorrie, Fiona Hyslop, Des McNulty, Mike Pringle, Alex Fergusson, Margaret Smith, Mrs Nanette Milne, Ms Wendy Alexander, Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Alex Neil, Roseanna Cunningham, Karen Whitefield, Tommy Sheridan, Robin Harper, Shiona Baird, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mike Rumbles, Rosie Kane, Margaret Mitchell, Ms Sandra White, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Irene Oldfather, Elaine Smith, Maureen Macmillan, Scott Barrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Patrick Harvie, Michael Matheson, Susan Deacon, Rob Gibson, Jeremy Purvis, Carolyn Leckie, Mr Andrew Welsh, Mary Scanlon, Sarah Boyack, Nicola Sturgeon, Karen Gillon, Jim Mather, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Chris Ballance, Bill Butler, Trish Godman, Cathy Peattie, Christine May, Pauline McNeill, Richard Baker, Mr John Swinney, Margo MacDonald, Frances Curran, Dennis Canavan, Nora Radcliffe Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
